subject: problem with ant build by using junit
msgSnippet: hi i try to create build.xml for my junit.my code is here. i am getting my .java source file from source directory destination for my javac is build
messageBody:
hi

i try to create build.xml for my junit.my code is here.

i am getting my .java source file from "source" directory

destination for my javac is "build" directory

my package structure is com.mot.am;

here is my build file


<project default="all">
<property name="tst-dir" location="source" />
<property name="TALK" value="true" />
<property name="build" location="build"/>
<property name="output_dir" location="output"/>

<path id="classpath.base">
</path>
<path id="classpath.test">
<pathelement location="${build}" />
<path refid="classpath.base" />
</path>


<target name="init">
<!-- Create the time stamp -->
<tstamp/>
<!-- Create the build directory structure used by compile -->
<mkdir dir="${build}"/>
</target>


<target name="compile-test">
<javac srcdir="${tst-dir}"
destdir="${build}"
verbose="${TALK}">
</javac>

</target>
<target name="clean-compile-test">
<delete verbose="${TALK}">
<fileset dir="${tst-dir}" includes="**/*.class" />
</delete>
</target>

<target name="test" depends="compile-test">
<junit printsummary="true">
<classpath location="${build}"/>
<classpath refid="classpath.test"/>


<formatter type="xml" usefile="yes" />

<batchtest fork="yes" todir="${output_dir}">
<fileset dir="${build}">
<include name="*.class" />
</fileset>
</batchtest>

<test name="TestTimeout.class">
</test>
</junit>
</target>

<target name="all" depends="test" />
<target name="clean" depends="clean-compile-test" />
</project>


While running this i am getting "class definition not found" exception.


IN THAT TestTimeOut.JAVA, I HAVE SUITE METHOD WHICH CALL THE SAME
FILE TestTimeOut.CLASS.


ANY BODY HELP ME WHAT IS THE PROBLEM , WHY MY BUILD FILE CAN'T
ABLE TO INVOKE THAT CLASS.

BY
SAM
